Get Default Output Config

Source: R/shared_config.R
default_output_args.Rd

Returns default output configuration. Useful for programmatic access.

Usage

default_output_args()

Value

output_args object with default settings

See also

output_args() for custom output configuration, interpret() for using output settings

Examples

# Get default output settings
defaults <- default_output_args()
print(defaults)
#> Output Configuration
#> ────────────────────────────────────────
#>   Format: cli
#>   Heading level: 1
#>   Suppress heading: FALSE
#>   Max line length: 80
#>   Verbosity: 2

# Use in interpret() call
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
interpretation <- interpret(
  fit_results = fa_result,
  variable_info = var_info,
  output_args = default_output_args(),
  llm_provider = "ollama",
  llm_model = "gpt-oss:20b-cloud"
)
} # }
